text: Stephen C. Joseph (born 1937, Brooklyn, New York City) was the New York City Health Commissioner from 1986 until 1990 after having worked at the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) as Special Coordinator for Child Health and Survival., He went on to become dean of the School of Public Health at the University of Minnesota and Assistant Secretary of Defense for Health Affairs. Joseph earned a bachelor's degree cum laude from Harvard College in 1959, a medical degree cum laude from the Yale School of Medicine in 1963 and a master of public health degree from Johns Hopkins University in 1968. ==Publications== *Dragon Within the Gates: The Once and Future AIDS Epidemic *Summer of Fifty-Seven: Coming of Age in Wyoming’s Shining Mountains *River of Stone, River of Sand: A Story of Medicine and Adventure ==References== ==External links== *Widespread Smoking Restrictions Start in NYC Category:1937 births Category:Living people Category:Commissioners of Health of the City of New York Category:Harvard College alumni Category:Yale School of Medicine alumni Category:Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health alumni Category:Writers from Brooklyn Category:University of Minnesota faculty Category:UNICEF people
